history.content:
----Co-Sponsored by AWE----

IXL Learning is hosting 1:1 chats with 4 of their engineers and 1 of their product managers. Here's an opportunity for students to meet engineers from different teams in IXL Learning, learn why they chose to work in EdTech, and ask any questions you may have about IXL and/or the interview process.

Sign-up for a time slot here

(Note: a Zoom link will be shared with you directly after you sign up)

Alyssa Trigg (Software Engineering Lead): Hi! My name is Alyssa Trigg. I graduated from Cornell University with a double major in Computer Science and Linguistics. I joined IXL Learning in September of 2018. During my time at IXL, I have worked on a number of different teams, including the signed out experience team, the admin analytics team, and the translated editions team. Currently I am the engineering lead for the teacher analytics team.

Andrea Lopez (Product Manager): I graduated from MIT in 2016 majoring in Computer Science. I joined IXL in the summer of 2017 (4.5 years!). Before that, I was a software engineer. I am currently the product manager in charge of our Diagnostic (assessment to identify student learning gaps and personalize instruction), and Administrator Analytics (data reporting at scale for large schools and districts).

Anne Silbaugh (Software Engineer): I graduated from Carnegie Mellon with a Bachelors of Science, majoring in Math. I joined IXL right afterwards, in June of 2020, and have been here since then! I actually started on the Integrations team (based in Toronto) at IXL, but switched over to the NC engineering team in early 2021 and am now working on the Wyzant product.

Perry Healy (Software Engineer): I graduated from the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill with a BS in Computer Science. I joined IXL as a Software Engineer in August 2020 and worked on the IXL content team before moving on to the Wyzant applications team in May 2021. On my team, I play a part in building, debugging, and testing features for Wyzant, working full-stack in a variety of coding languages including Ruby, Go, and C#.

Yossra Hamid (Software Engineer): Hi everyone! My name is Yossra Hamid, and I'm a senior software engineer on the Education.com team. I joined IXL a little over a year ago, and I've really enjoyed the work I get to do and the people I get to do it with. I graduated from Duke University in 2016.
history.subject: IXL Learning Tech Talk - 2/23 from 12pm-1pm
